actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and Environment.

official_title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to require States Medicaid plans to provide for payment for costs of medical services under individualized education programs under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act after they exceed $3,500 in a school year.

summary.text: Smart IDEA Act of 1999 - Amends title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act to require State Medicaid plans to cover the costs of medical services furnished to any child under an individualized education program for that child under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act after such costs exceed $3,500 in any school year.

titles.title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to require States Medicaid plans to provide for payment for costs of medical services under individualized education programs under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act after they exceed $3,500 in a school year.
